description: Visual perception & cognition is one of the most active areas in the field of brain research. Psychologists, neuroscientists, opthamologists and optometrists, computer scientists, and engineers all have interests in the specific sides of the subject. The research interests of Center for Visual Cognition and Brain-Inspired Computation (ViCBiC) are to understand the physiological mechanisms of visual neural coding, perception, cognition and computation at different levels, and to build brain-like or brain-inspired computational models available to the fields of both experimental neuroscience and computer vision.
